title: To recently unperma'd players - how are you doing with your account?

embed.description: Posting this on Lito instead of ShinodaChan because this is (hopefully) the account I myself will be participating on. I CAN'T STRESS THIS ENOUGH - IF YOU ARE PARTICIPATING, ACTUALLY REFORM AND DON'T WASTE THE CHANCE. This is a rare opportunity for players ONLY IN NORTH AMERICA to show h

body:
Pretty straightforward - are you having a good time, hard time or somewhere inbetween? I'm making this both so I can get a vague sense as to how things are going & so that I can offer advice/help if needed. So if you wanna share your experience, put it here. 

Enjoy your freed account and please, **PLEASE** - reform. {{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

replies.body: I don't have the same views on toxicity as majority of the sub in here, I'm only (reformed) because I have to, not because I want to, I don't type because I can lose my account. I think toxicity is meme'd around especially in ranked, I think that the higher elo you go, the more toxic there is, and people will say causation!=correlation, but I disagree, I think toxicity in general is healthy for competition. Downvote me for disagreeing, like always.

agree. We live in a pussy culture where everyone cares more about words and feelings than results. I would rather have a toxic 10/0 than a "i'm a nice player I will report you if you are toxic" 0/10 on my team.

Also riot only did this because a lot of NA players quitting, hoping for some veterans coming back. kinda pathetic after they ruining this game.

> [{quoted}](name=minus 25k,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=00000005,timestamp=2018-08-02T19:55:48.977+0000)
>
> agree. We live in a pussy culture where everyone cares more about words and feelings than results. I would rather have a toxic 10/0 than a "i'm a nice player I will report you if you are toxic" 0/10 on my team.
> 
> Also riot only did this because a lot of NA players quitting, hoping for some veterans coming back. kinda pathetic after they ruining this game.

People want respect. That's simply all there is to it. If you refuse to respect other people, you should stay at home and not take part in greater society as a whole.
Really, it's the simplest of notions, wanting respect. Why is that _SO DIFFICULT_ for other people to give? You would absolutely be one of the first people to tear down the doors and raise a commotion if you weren't being respected and your rights were being infringed upon, so why do you get to be respected while other people do not?

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=000000050000,timestamp=2018-08-02T21:29:28.708+0000)
>
> People want respect. That's simply all there is to it. If you refuse to respect other people, you should stay at home and not take part in greater society as a whole.
> Really, it's the simplest of notions, wanting respect. Why is that _SO DIFFICULT_ for other people to give? You would absolutely be one of the first people to tear down the doors and raise a commotion if you weren't being respected and your rights were being infringed upon, so why do you get to be respected while other people do not?

What about in the case of flaming someone who is grieving/intentionally feeding. It is clear they couldn't give a damn about respect because they are stomping on their 4 team mates due to having a bad time on their own. I am not saying you should be allowed to flame them, but your case revolves around giving people respect, I wholeheartedly agree in the regular case, but what about when it comes to trolls?

That's where we can all disagree with the rules of the game. Yeah, you **should** be allowed to tell the 0/17 Nunu with 4 tears and mobis that he's a flaming shit-pile, but the system doesn't like that and you might get banned. It's dumb, but that's the way it is.

> [{quoted}](name=TheCodeisCupCake,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=0000000500000001,timestamp=2018-08-03T10:44:48.624+0000)
>
> What about in the case of flaming someone who is grieving/intentionally feeding. It is clear they couldn't give a damn about respect because they are stomping on their 4 team mates due to having a bad time on their own. I am not saying you should be allowed to flame them, but your case revolves around giving people respect, I wholeheartedly agree in the regular case, but what about when it comes to trolls?

Just because someone is doing something disrespectful doesn't give you the full green light to do the same back to them. If you disapprove of someone's behavior, mute them, ignore them, then report them after the fact. But don't sit there an engage with them in the same disrespectful fashion, because your behavior is not canceled out by their behavior. Keeping calm and collected when forced into situations like that is called civility, and without it everything falls apart and then we're no better than gorillas or chimps. We as people learn how to act in social situations, and we should have been taught what to do at a very young age - and I can think of no societal norm that says "If someone is mean to you, be mean right back at them, and start a fight, and cause a scene, because that's how you deal with people who upset you." It doesn't exist, because that is juvenile and the most childish way to cope with being disrespected.
So if trolls are upsetting you, ignore them, mute them and report them. Don't feed into their behavior, because then you're dragging yourself down to their level and putting yourself at risk of being lumped in with them.
What rights are being infringed by me calling someone a bitchass?

> [{quoted}](name=SugeMinPikk,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=0000000500000000,timestamp=2018-08-03T03:29:27.847+0000)
>
> What rights are being infringed by me calling someone a bitchass?

Their right to have a game without harassment.
With that I can agree but what about the toxic players that intentionally throw games how do you feel about that?

> [{quoted}](name=Proxhawk,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=000000050001,timestamp=2018-08-03T03:27:33.076+0000)
>
> With that I can agree but what about the toxic players that intentionally throw games how do you feel about that?

If it's true intentional feed I save replay and screenshot and submit ticket and hope for punishment. However riot doesn't care. Their policy is that you can int as much as you want but if you say one single word that someone doesn't like, we will punish you for that. I've submit ticket like that. Nothing happened. That's why I see this game's player behavior system as a complete joke.

That's fair, and I agree with you for the most part, I think someone intentionally ruining the game should be punished alot worse than people do for saying things (however there is a point where you can cross a line in chat that shouldn't be crossed and needs punishment)

Yeah a tilted player feeding the tilt with flame losing the game is fun for the other teammates and healthy for competition.
You can be competitive without looking like an ass.

Once again , since I have different view, let me explain my view.

I think a lot of players have the "always winnable" attitude, when you play ranked for so long, and play for a long time, you know when the game is over, I don't care about a personal story about coming back from a deficit  2-12 etc, games done. This is what I think that makes players toxic, the hostage attitude players have, there's always one person who always thinks its winnable regardless if its 0-20 or whatever.

I mean yeah sometimes people can be blind, but you still should give it your all and not make it a reason to flame.
if you do then you're replacing competitive spirit for toxic attitude, and that's literally the opposite of healthy for the game.

Agreed, if I know it's a lost cause I'll start the surrender vote or vote yes, but if the vote doesnt go through (usually cause one person says no), I still try my best. As long as you're in the game it's possible, but if I had the choice, I would surrender because it is the likely outcome.

It doesn't give you permission to afk or whatever because you don't feel like you're going to win.

> [{quoted}](name=Lichformed,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-02T16:59:36.308+0000)
>
> I mean yeah sometimes people can be blind, but you still should give it your all and not make it a reason to flame.
> if you do then you're replacing competitive spirit for toxic attitude, and that's literally the opposite of healthy for the game.

How does this get down votes?  Haha. I came to the boards for a couple weeks now. It seems if you aren't negative you get the DV.  Strange lot.

> [{quoted}](name=Lichformed,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-08-02T16:46:46.781+0000)
>
> Yeah a tilted player feeding the tilt with flame losing the game is fun for the other teammates and healthy for competition.
> You can be competitive without looking like an ass.

I mean, personally I prefer to be matched with a flamer rather than an intentional feeder/afk/griefer. Im sure most would be too. Same saying as always but, you can mute one, you can't mute the other (for feeding)

^^^^^^^^PLEASE LOUDER FOR THE PEOPLE AT THE BACK. "tOxIc pLaYeRs RuIn ThE gAmE" its like they can't press ONE BUTTON TO MUTE and focus on the game. League these days players feel like they must pay attention to every word said on chat like its actually real its text on the god damn screen mute them move on if that person really is toxic and playing horribly and not trying his best to win and from the start they deserve a ban PERIOD those who try to win but lose because 1 teammate decides to int and gives up and ends up flaming are always discriminated and sent off as "excessively toxic" this game became less focus on individual merit in terms of gameplay and more on behavior you can have a bad game feed a bit and not try as hard to win but if you say gg and are nice you're a better player than the player who works his ass off in a chair for 40 mins and gets frustrated when a teammate makes a bonehead decision late game that loses the game people don't take into account that you can spend over 50 mins playing a ranked game and deciding to int when its clearly winnable or afk is not acceptable at all. Its like soft inting and rage quitting/afking on purpose to tilt is being ignored but if you call someone out for it you're "toxic" even though you're trying your hardest to win but those players that don't give a fuck and would rather give up and afk which will go unpunished.

https://imgur.com/a/qFWXQ2H

https://imgur.com/a/kFb7TVd 

As an Yasuo main almost every game Im disrespected and ignore it as much as I can. One "wonderful" day a little annoying Zoe appeard in a Normal Game on my Team. I was playing adc in 8.14 lul as Jhin with a Thresh support. We lost lane and Zoe started aggressively to blame me and I was like " The next annoyance that disrespects me". Im not such a fan of Zoe players and when she started to ping me for everything i boiled up and replied her as she deserved (You can see what I've said in the pictures). After the game ended I didnt report her ( because I dont want to be a bad guy, i just lost my nerves), but she reported me. Fifteen minutes later THE GREAT Instant Feedback Report banned me due to detecting "kys". 

I was honor level 4 ( 3 checkpoints) and now honor level 0 with locked rewards because Im "far below the standarts of League community". 
And the thing that i dont understand is why they said "everyone deserves respect on the Rift" when Im endlessly blamed for being an Yasuo main.

Well.. that's from me... Great system, Great game!

_Note: This is my second account. The first one got permanently banned because it was hacked and someone else used third party programs_
And how is this relevant to the thread?
It makes him feel better about himself.

im really curious because many ppl said "ik about the 14 day ban being my last chance, but the perma really made me understand that im the problem" so yea. i wonder how these ppl will behave.

and i really hope euw (and all servers) get that same chance.

> [{quoted}](name=Arammus,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-08-02T20:38:05.979+0000)

Well based on what Riot posted and it being a pilot program. EUW and other region's chances depend on the the unbanned reformed formerly permabanned accounts not getting rebanned. If the program doesn't work, the experiment ends and Riot won't entertain the idea for other accounts. 

So I'm sure those hoping for a second chance in other regions are crossing their fingers that these NA accounts don't screw up their chances and stay on their best behavior.

I'm still waiting to get an opportunity as many people. It's been almost 2 years since my ban and I learned a lot of things after it. Especially learning to have a positive attitude, it's a videogame so you are supposed to have fun rather than having a bad moment.

I hope an agent reads my ticket soon, I'm hoping to get an opportunity to prove players like us can change.
When did you submit the ticket?

Still waiting for riot to answer my ticket. Can you help me please? This account i'm on is the one.
I'm still waiting too, it's just that a ton of people are taking the chance to apply. Don't respond to your ticket & just wait it out I suppose, we'll get a response eventually - I know it!

Wasn’t suprised, I still believe that they want this to fail in order to vindicate themselves in the shear amount of perma bans they hand out.

EDIT: I also assume some more of you got the letter, considering they said it was a mass produced statement.
I don't know because I'm still waiting.

how long does it take?  also are you at honor 2?
A few days for Riot to process the ticket & then potentially a two week suspension so Riot can punish you a little longer. I have yet to be unbanned so I'm not sure as to how honor works.

> [{quoted}](name=Captain Lito,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=7A36lpIH,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2018-08-02T22:58:11.949+0000)

if they dont fix the honor i dont think there's a point because they're just going to group the low honors together to make them engage each other like they usually do
I highly doubt that Wookie will do that because it'd just be repeating a major flaw of the Level 20 Challenge, hopefully they'll be avoiding that.

I've had a ticket in for two accounts to have them unbanned, they were perma'd years ago. My tickets have been open since 7/30.. so four days. Is that typical? Or should I just consider that the response?

I have no experience with tickets.
Typical, just keep waiting! Sorry that the queue's so long. {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

Ok, thanks for the response :)

It doesn't matter how long the wait is as long as there will eventually be a reply. I mean I got the accounts banned so if nothing happens it's my fault anyway. I just don't like *not* getting an answer!
All perma banned players have to wait 2weeks so it will probably be two weeks before we know anything which is weird lol
Yeah ,this may have been a bit early on my part lol {{sticker:sg-zephyr}}

Hey there Lito,

It seems that I'm not in the same boat as everyone else I've encountered that had their permanent bans lifted. I didn't had to wait the two-week period before playing again. Could be that I never had a two-week ban in my case (skipped straight to a permanent ban)?

https://imgur.com/a/q4U0pqk

I'm not sure yet because they have yet to contact me about my own ban. There are two possibilities:

1. You're right & because you never had a two week (instant perma) you were excused & started off fresh.

2. The duration of your punishment (2+ years) was already long enough that it was pointless to force you to have to also endure a two week suspension, hence Riot chose against forcing you into it. 

Depending on what they do relative to my account (this one having been banned since May 2017) it'll more so look like either #1 or #2 is correct. Alternatively there's a #3 which is that you got special treatment because of your agent but that's very, VERY unlikely.

This came way too late. Majority of permabanned players have already created 1 or much more new accounts, and may even have multiple permabans. Giving them access to more free accounts will only encourage them to be even more toxic.

If this was done back in 2011-2012, people would actually consider reforming.

They literally did try this in 2012, if I have the date right. Perma'd players had the opportunity to level a fresh account to 20 in order to prove their reformation and earn their main back. It failed SO MISERABLY that they scrapped the project until today. Frankly, I expect the same thing to happen now in 2018.

I think otherwise Its been 6 years and those who were excessively toxic are probably gone. I think its better they unbar the account and see instead of starting from lvl 1 only time will tell alot of pressure on these NA players because this is their last chance for the ENTIRE LOL community after that other regions can choose for themselves. This is bigger than it seems and can hopefully bring back lost accounts especially those who put money.

If this succeeds, I’ll be happy for the players who demonstrate reformation and get unbanned. Good for them. 

My point is that I see no reason to expect a different result from the 2012 test.

i really hope people of NA show promise so us in EUW can get a chance  :/ 
really sucks i was banned for having an awful day with my father and i went afk in a ranked game because i couldn't stand his abuse of the network and my teammates reported me even tho i told them i had 2k ms and even if i didnt stay at base i would've died way more times and been worse for them.
i also had a case of liver inflammation and had to take opoids which made me get angry rather easily.
i dont remember if i flamed the team then since it was 2 years ago but i'm a changed man now, im healthy and my father is in jail since he wasnt a good person to begin with. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} 
too bad riot support thought it was a lie maybe.
